capsule: ^A cylindral, blue object shines from roadside shrubbery. It looks like a keg, but it clearly is small enough to hold on your lap. Judging by the way it's fallen and  rusted over, it's been here for a while.
approach: ^It's sealed shut, but if you can sneak a piece of paper in between the lid and the body, you could probably loosen it. It would mean losing a paper stamp, though.
open: ^After opening the lid, you notice there's a multitude of small objects inside. Mostly colored marbles, old coins, greyed-out photos, along with a small letter.
^"--2075-- time capsule-- favorite small things-- memories-- eca Parker."
^At the bottom of the letter, there is a crude map, luckily not wiped away by time. "Go West, past Diner." Chances are you might hit upon this object on the road.
abandon: ^If you can't open it with your own hands, why bother opening it at all? There must be a reason why it's sealed so tight. You leave the cylinder alone and return to the van.
